bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: George Morris (1903-1997) was a long-time labor journalist, principally for the Communist Party USA's newspapers, the Daily Worker (national newspaper) and the Western Worker, their successor titles, and was also at one time head of the Party's National Labor Commission. Born to Jewish parents in the Ukraine, he came to the United States at age sixteen and was one of the founding members of the Communist Party USA.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Donated by Helen Morris in 1997. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.071. Additional materials were received from Helen Morris in 2001.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by George Morris are held by his widow Helen Morris. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which she holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Helen Morris.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains articles by George Morris and others, research materials, speeches and correspondence.
